message: Where can one find more sphinx themes?
https://github.com/coordt/ADCtheme
@coordt nice find!
I like that theme , tks @coordt
looks good http://files.droplr.com/files/6077392/w7rv.Screen%20shot%202011-02-25%20at%2016%3A50%3A56.png
Also, my kingdom for an extension that will let me use markdown rather than rst. Golly.
I've seen some posting messages where an image get's displayed , how do they make it happen?
it gets displayed like a thumbnail
@jdaguilera It's possible that the : and spaces in that URL broke convore's regex.
Yeah, it's nice
http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/mock/index.html
We need a pile more sphinx themes. Python needs more designer talent :(
I like the pyramid theme too.
sphinxjp provides theme via pypi http://pypi.python.org/pypi?%3Aaction=search&term=sphinxjp.themes&submit=search
@jessenoller I say we try to get @kneath to make us a new default theme for the python docs

@theomn that's never going to happen. I used to say the exact same thing, before I started using rest. Now I use it for everything but prose, and find it extremely powerful and useful. It def grows on you.
@jessenoller I think I'll take you up on that (Sphinx themes).

@jessenoller Our read the docs theme is coming along well. Got a real designer working on it at the PDX Sprints yesterday. Some of our improvements will hopefully get submitted back to core sphinx as well
@ericholscher Niiiiiice
a sphinx theme library (of appropriately licensed themes) would be great
Cool
Should be noted it's very easy to roll your own custom theme
If you inherit the base theme you can get away with just a little CSS
@micrypt Not using Git or similar? :D
Getting on with it. http://forrst.com/posts/Sphinx_theme_WIP-g3c
@micrypt That looks real good; did you make that just now?
@dag This morning, yes. Thanks. I'm planning on making quite a few more over time.
@dag Haha. No, not at this point.
Is there a release or published source code somewhere @micrypt?
Not yet. I'll release it as soon as I'm done & added some polish. :)
@micrypt Hey. I run readthedocs.org, which hosts sphinx documentation, and I'd love to include your themes as choices for people's documentation once you release them.
@ericholscher That would be awesome. I'll give you a shout as things progress.
